candidates.title: Bump Tokio and Regex versions
candidates.body:
Updating Tokio ensures [RUSTSEC-2021-0124](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2021-0124.html) will not happen if `tokio::sync::oneshot` is used in the future

Updating Regex fixes [RUSTSEC-2022-0013](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2022-0013.html) which allows DOS attack/issues. better safe than sorry.

~~I don't know why the commit is `Unverified` I made the change through GitHub's web editor so it would automatically create the fork~~

candidates.title: fix broken serenity event handler
candidates.body: Serenity seems to have had a recent update that removed the CategoryCreate and CategoryDelete Event enum variants. This PR removes those variants as well. Tested by checking if the lib compiles.

candidates.title: Fix deprecation warnings for `serenity::interactions`
candidates.body:
This fixes the deprecation warnings for the upcoming serenity 0.11.3 version.
<!-- please base the PR on the develop branch if possible 😇 -->

candidates.title: Don't pull in chrono by default
candidates.body: Avoids pulling in the unmaintained and vulnerable chrono library via a serenity feature by default

candidates.title: Localization
candidates.body:
Fixes #79

As described in #79, there are two ways to localize commands: via attributes, or programmatically.

Attributes are good for small scale bots because they're easy to get started with and simple: for example `#[name_localized("de", "Befehlsname")]` to set the German-localized name to "Befehlsname". A full example is in examples/framework_usage/commands/localization.rs

The programmatical approach is better for larger bots that use a translation framework like gettext, fluent: you can insert localizations of all commands with a single code snippet by modifying the `name_localizations` and `description_localizations` fields of `Command`, `CommandParameter` and `CommandParameterChoice`. A full example is in examples/fluent_localization/

CI on this PR currently fails due to deprecation warnings that haven't been released to crates.io. I'd like to fix those warnings in a separate commit, so I'll leave this PR's CI failing.

candidates.title: Fix poise with latest serenity
candidates.body:
<!-- please base the PR on the develop branch if possible 😇 -->
Recent breaking changes on serenity (https://github.com/serenity-rs/serenity/pull/1808 and https://github.com/serenity-rs/serenity/commit/0397494dfe8dc73a03715dacedd590e4d25ebe25) made poise not compile, this fixes that.

candidates.title: Add ctx and framework to listener error
candidates.body:
<!-- please base the PR on the develop branch if possible 😇 -->
`FrameworkError::Listener` gets a surprising lack of `serenity::Context` or `Framework`, let's fix that!

candidates.title: Attachments
candidates.body:
Attachment support as option type. 

Currently, it:
* Compiles
* Prefix cmds can work with 1+ attachment argument
* Slash commands accept 1+ attachment args

Still needs:
* ~~Slash commands to 'work' (currently they silently fail- not sure why?)~~
* ~~Prefix cmds to work with 2+ attachments (gonna require passing some more state I think)~~

candidates.title: Ensure global checks are always ran
candidates.body: Fixes issue where if a command specified its own checks, global checks (those registered on the framework) would not be ran
